overall_summary: The reasoning employs a practical approach focused on daily seasonality and simple averaging due to limited historical data (4 days). It prioritizes handling visible patterns over complex modeling, acknowledging data constraints while ensuring completeness in forecasts. The method emphasizes pattern recognition and baseline heuristics rather than advanced statistical techniques.
common_data_patterns: Time-of-day patterns (peaks at night/early morning, troughs at noon)
key_insights: Identification of consistent daily patterns across 4 days of historical data
Explicit rejection of weekly seasonality/trend analysis due to insufficient data
Use of hourly averages as forecast values to preserve daily cyclicality
Data completeness checks before model selection
Adaptation to data scope constraints via simplified repeating patterns
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with initial consideration of statistical models (ARIMA, Holt-Winters), but ultimately relying on simple heuristics due to data limitations. Includes multi-step validation of assumptions about seasonality and missing values.
